org.jerkar.api.depmanagement

Class JkDependencyResolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkDependencyResolver

  • public final class JkDependencyResolver
extends java.lang.Object
    A resolver for a given set of dependency. Each instance of JkDependencyResolver defines the dependencies to resolve, this means that you must instantiate one for each dependency set you want to resolve.
    Each instance of JkDependencyResolver keep in cache resolution setting so a resolution o a given scope is never computed twice. The result of the resolution depends on the parameters you have set on it. See JkResolutionParameters

    • Method Detail

      • managed

        public static JkDependencyResolver managed(JkRepos repos,
                                           JkDependencies dependencies)
        Creates a dependency resolver relying on a dependency manager. Such a resolver is able to resolve dependencies transitively downloading artifacts hosted on Maven or Ivy repository. If you don't have module dependencies (only local dependencies) then you'd better use unmanaged(JkDependencies) instead.

      • unmanaged

        public static JkDependencyResolver unmanaged(JkDependencies dependencies)
        Creates a dependency manager that does not need to rely on a dependency manager. This is a case when you use only local file dependencies.

      • dependenciesToResolve

        public JkDependencies dependenciesToResolve()
        Returns the dependencies this resolver has been instantiated with.

      • resolve

        public JkResolveResult resolve(java.lang.Iterable<JkScope> scopes)
        See Also:
        resolve(JkScope...)

      • resolve

        public JkResolveResult resolve(JkScope... scopes)
        Resolves the managed dependencies (dependencies declared as external module) for the specified scopes. If no scope is specified, then it is resolved for all scopes.

      • getAttachedArtifacts

        public JkAttachedArtifacts getAttachedArtifacts(java.util.Set<JkVersionedModule> modules,
                                                JkScope... scopes)
        Gets artifacts belonging to the same module as the specified ones but having the specified scopes.

      • get

        public JkPath get(JkScope... scopes)
        Gets the path containing all the resolved dependencies as artifact files for the specified scopes.

        If no scope is specified then return all file dependencies and the dependencies specified. About the managed dependency the same rule than for resolve(JkScope...) apply.

        The result is ordered according the order dependencies has been declared. About ordering of transitive dependencies, they come after the explicit ones and the dependee of the first explicitly declared dependency come before the dependee of the second one and so on.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this resolver does not contain any dependencies.

      • withModuleHolder

        public JkDependencyResolver withModuleHolder(JkVersionedModule versionedModule)
        The underlying dependency manager can cache the resolution on file system for faster result. To make this caching possible, you must set the module+version for which the resolution is made. This is only relevant for managed dependencies and have no effect for unmanaged dependencies.

      • withTransitiveVersionOverride

        public JkDependencyResolver withTransitiveVersionOverride(JkVersionProvider transitiveVersionOverride)
        Provides a mean to force module versions coming from transitive dependencies.

      • withParams

        public JkDependencyResolver withParams(JkResolutionParameters params)
        You can alter the resolver behavior through these settings. his is only relevant for managed dependencies and have no effect for unmanaged dependencies.

      • withDependencies

        public JkDependencyResolver withDependencies(JkDependencies dependencies)
        Returns a dependency resolver identical to this one but with the specified dependencies.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
